Posts.Title: Hopefully an answer

Posts.Content: kchiu32, sorry about your dad but given the circumstances I'm glad you found this site. Many people I am sure will give you the benefit of their experience and recommendations, all will be worthwhile. I was diagnosed at 65 and also had controlled hypertension and high cholesterol. Obviously you see that some sort of action is required based on your dad's numbers. In my opinion you have two good options: Surgery or radiation. If you have concerns about surgery then you should get a 2nd opinion from an oncologist. Most posters here I believe went with and would still choose surgery. I would recommend you see a good surgeon and get his opinion on your dad's condition and what side affects he should expect. You and your dad then need to have the same type of conversation with an oncologist. Both types of surgery are equally successful in my opinion, but robotic is far less invasive, and healing time is dramatically shorter. I think you will find the side affects for surgery and radiation are quite similar. Good Luck, Please keep us in the loop. Allen

Posts.Content: Welcome to the site montrob. Given your great success with continence for a fairly long period after post surgery, I would suggest you look first at your Kegel routine. It may be you have increased your K exercises or conversely you may have cut back to far on them. I suggest you ensure you are doing kegel exercises at the exact level (no more, no less) that you did day 1. If it still doesn't help, then you need to discuss next steps with your surgeon. I know how you feel about the ED situation, I had my surgery approx. 18 months ago and I still have ED although 2 urologists told me my ED should last up to 6 months. I am now using Trimix for erections. I agree with newporter in that life is precious and I wouldn't trade 10 weeks let alone 10 years of life for unassisted ERECTION. Life is more important than sex, to me anyway. Good Luck Allen

One of the best things you can do is dial into this site when you feel worried or stressed and let someone chat you through it. Keep a smile on your face. Like the rest of us you are looking down at the grass not up. Enjoy doing what you love every day and hopefully you have decades more to enjoy it. Hang in there & stay positive B

Posts.Title: Yet another concern

Posts.Content: I had my 1st experience with the symptoms you describe about 6 years ago, my doctor did an ultrasound of my bladder and determined it to be a prostate infection. She put me on an antibiotic for 6 weeks as prostate infection takes a while to control. I started feeling better 12 hours after the first pill. It reoccurred 2 years later and she just gave me another script for 6 weeks and it went away. Long story short , a few years later she sent me to a urologist who had me have a biopsy. The rest is old news, I had pc. Keep a close watch on your condition and please keep in touch B

Posts.Title: How long is too long?

Posts.Content: My psa remained at zero for a year after surgery, then surged to 0.12. My surgeon took another test a month later and it was still at 0.12. I refused to wait and watch further so went to an oncologist and had radiation. They usually don't look at the psa for at least 3 months after treatments stop but I was curious as I was heading to Florida for 4 months. The day I had my last treatment (Dec 24th) he did a psa and told me not to expect any change from the 0.12 but it had already dropped to 0.1. HE was happy, I was thrilled. I will get next psa done at the end of April and expecting to return back to zero.The tough part of the treatments was that you had to have a FULL bladder and an EMPTY bowel every day. I looked forward to weekends. But thankfully I had ZERO side affects from the treatments. B

Posts.Title: Prostatitus concern

Posts.Content: Beeman, it seems like the continence is coming along well for you but not the ED. I was fully continent eight weeks after my robotic surgery(2012) but then in 2013 I required Salvage Radiation and still was continent except when doing my running (6 miles ) I used about 1/2 pad a day for two years before that cleared up. My ED still continues, at first I had no luck with Viagra or Cialis and used TriMix .It worked fantastic, after another 2 years I found 100mg Viagra worked well enough for penetration and ejaculation. I still use TriMix occasionally as I have never experienced any pain. I do get a headache, and flushing with Viagra. Just be patient, it will come. You are healthy, young, and fortunate to be a Gleason 6. I am a 7 (3+4) and was 65 when I had original surgery. Good Luck Allen
Posts.Title: 10 months after 2 questions

Posts.Content: Tybeeman, you are an extremely lucky PC survivor with a G6 outcome, plus remaining long term in the zero club. No reason for you to fixate on something bad happening now. Put your upcoming procedure out of your mind and enjoy all you have the rest will fall into place for you. Good Luck Allen

Posts.Content: Hang in there and keep up the kegels. I was 7 weeks before becoming total continent. The first couple of weeks I had little to no control over leakage. I was ok sitting but when I stood up I started squirting. You will notice that as time passes, hopefully weeks, you will be able to sleep at night without any leakage. Usually the first sign full continence is on its way. Good luck Allen

Posts.Title: New to Site, Hello

Posts.Content: Welcome Ted, to be brief I would suggest you have the biopsy. When I was 65 I had no symptoms normally associated with PC. My doctor said my prostate felt smooth, and soft. However my psa had climbed over the previous 5 years, similar to yours. I had the biopsy and had a Gleason score of 7 (3+4). After surgery my uro told me "lucky you didn't do active surveillance ". Do not buy into the saying that PC takes 10 years to kill you... Not Always True. Good Luck Allen

Posts.Title: Time for another biopsy?

Posts.Content: I had my 1st experience with the symptoms you describe about 6 years ago, my doctor did an ultrasound of my bladder and determined it to be a prostate infection. She put me on an antibiotic for 6 weeks as prostate infection takes a while to control. I started feeling better 12 hours after the first pill. It reoccurred 2 years later and she just gave me another script for 6 weeks and it went away. Long story short , a few years later she sent me to a urologist who had me have a biopsy. The rest is old news, I had pc. Keep a close watch on your condition and please keep in touch B

Posts.Title: Prescription tip

Posts.Content: Welcome lost, Sorry you were waiting so long, if they were busier than expected they at least could have advised you going in. That experience on it's own would raise your stress level. I think you have let yourself absorb only the tough side of the biopsy. Mine was noisier than I expected but 99% pain free. I had zero bleeding afterwards. There really is no substitute for it , so next time think positive and when you arrive at clinic ask if they expect delays, if they do then ask how long. Wouldn't hurt to take a book or magazine. Good luck Allen

Posts.Title: I am a wife whose husband has just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Only two potential things I an think of is: He is allergic to that particular brand of pull up or pad, as they aren't all the same. Try another brand. OR it could be he needs to change pull-UPS or pads more often. OR he may not be washing the area well enough. Talk to any pharmacist and they can recommend a good cream. The pharmacist could also recommend a different brand. Good Luck B
Posts.Title: Post Surgery Recovery

Posts.Content: Not sure how you can prepare in advance. A diaper type rash for men after catheter removed is very rare. Obviously if the person was bed ridden that would be different. Just change pull ups or pads at appropriate time. Start each morning with a clean one, not one left over from day before. As I said some companies add chemicals to eliminate smell. If you were allergic to this chemical you could get a rash, in which case change to one that doesn't add chemicals.

Posts.Title: Confirmed....SRT to begin

Posts.Content: Welcome to the site montrob. Given your great success with continence for a fairly long period after post surgery, I would suggest you look first at your Kegel routine. It may be you have increased your K exercises or conversely you may have cut back to far on them. I suggest you ensure you are doing kegel exercises at the exact level (no more, no less) that you did day 1. If it still doesn't help, then you need to discuss next steps with your surgeon. I know how you feel about the ED situation, I had my surgery approx. 18 months ago and I still have ED although 2 urologists told me my ED should last up to 6 months. I am now using Trimix for erections. I agree with newporter in that life is precious and I wouldn't trade 10 weeks let alone 10 years of life for unassisted ERECTION. Life is more important than sex, to me anyway. Good Luck Allen

Posts.Title: I am a wife whose husband has just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: I can't imagine your doctor is charging by the hour so I guess when he finishes a resident will close you up. My surgeon told me upfront he was allowing 5 hours although he may finish a little sooner.As I said earlier I was 4:45 . If I wanted to be in and out quickly I would have gone for the standard surgery which takes 1/2 the time or less of Robotic, however I had 2 urologists recommend the robotic because it was significantly less invasive, I asked my GP and she said that 80% of her patients in the past 5 years who had pc went for the robotic. The difference is the standard surgery is like cutting a square around an onion and removing it. Robotic is like removing the onion by peeling and removing 1 layer at a time. B

Posts.Title: My journey update... (Brachytherapy)

Posts.Content: Welcome Stark, sorry about your father's rising PSA. Firstly it is high enough to bear watching but not high enough to stress out over. I assume your father's doctor will order another PSA in a few months and if it climbs he may want to do a biopsy, or, he may want to do a biopsy now. My PSA climbed from 3.5 to 6.5 over 2 years and I biopsy did show I had PC. Your dad's could be due to other reasons . It would help to know his readings over past 3 or 4 years. Get as much info as you can re past PSA tests and we can better give you suggestions. Good Luck, Keep us up to speed and know we are here for you and your dad. Allen

Posts.Title: Who Has a Post-op Ejaculate?

Posts.Content: catsforkids, I finished 33 rounds of radiation on Dec 24th and had virtually zero side affects. After spending Christmas with the family we left for our house in Florida. Since being here I have golfed 3 times a week, gone deep sea fishing, and attended several parties, all without any side affects. Having said that I am 66 which is not young but younger than your dad I think. However I did meet several men at treatment in your dad's age group and older and they suffered only minor inconvenience. The Inconvenience is they want your bowel empty and your bladder full for each treatment. Other than some of the older men doing the 100 yard dash for the men's room to empty their bladder after treatment which takes totally about 10 min there were no other side affects I heard about. All the best Allen

This morning After getting up I went to washroom and zero blood. I then went on a 3 mile power walk and when I returned there was quite a bit of blood in urine. Posts.Title: Seems never ending

Posts.Content: I thought my bladder/kidney issue was over but it just keeps popping up. I met today with my urologist who performed my Di Vinci, he told me I had a small cyst in each kidney , nothing to worry about. He did a Cysto while I was there and now I'm stressed. My bladder has enlarged veins due to the radiation which is no problem , however thereis a large bright pink section on the wall of my bladder and he's not sure about it. He could see no tumours but took another urine analysis and sent it to the lab along with the Cysto picture. I have to wait 2 weeks for the results. I planned on leaving for Florida tomorrow but will postpone it. Allen

Posts.Content: Hang in there and keep up the kegels. I was 7 weeks before becoming total continent. The first couple of weeks I had little to no control over leakage. I was ok sitting but when I stood up I started squirting. You will notice that as time passes, hopefully weeks, you will be able to sleep at night without any leakage. Usually the first sign full continence is on its way. Good luck Allen
Posts.Title: A Return to Continence

Posts.Content: I thought my bladder/kidney issue was over but it just keeps popping up. I met today with my urologist who performed my Di Vinci, he told me I had a small cyst in each kidney , nothing to worry about. He did a Cysto while I was there and now I'm stressed. My bladder has enlarged veins due to the radiation which is no problem , however thereis a large bright pink section on the wall of my bladder and he's not sure about it. He could see no tumours but took another urine analysis and sent it to the lab along with the Cysto picture. I have to wait 2 weeks for the results. I planned on leaving for Florida tomorrow but will postpone it. Allen

Posts.Title: New to Site, Hello

Posts.Content: I was about 10 days from the time I was advised to have a biopsy to the time I was on the table getting it. Upon completion they told me not to do anything strenuous for 24 hours but other than that go about your day as normal. How long it takes you to get your biopsy will depend on how many men are getting one. Where I went they had 4 rooms which were being used, the procedure is not fun at all, however it doesn't take long. Fifteen -Twenty minutes, sort of depends how much time you take up with screaming obscenities (JOKING)

Posts.Title: Five years in the zero club

Posts.Content: Beeman, it seems like the continence is coming along well for you but not the ED. I was fully continent eight weeks after my robotic surgery(2012) but then in 2013 I required Salvage Radiation and still was continent except when doing my running (6 miles ) I used about 1/2 pad a day for two years before that cleared up. My ED still continues, at first I had no luck with Viagra or Cialis and used TriMix .It worked fantastic, after another 2 years I found 100mg Viagra worked well enough for penetration and ejaculation. I still use TriMix occasionally as I have never experienced any pain. I do get a headache, and flushing with Viagra. Just be patient, it will come. You are healthy, young, and fortunate to be a Gleason 6. I am a 7 (3+4) and was 65 when I had original surgery. Good Luck Allen

Posts.Title: First Few Days Home After Surgery - Do I need Someone Their Fulltime?

Posts.Content: Welcome Ted, to be brief I would suggest you have the biopsy. When I was 65 I had no symptoms normally associated with PC. My doctor said my prostate felt smooth, and soft. However my psa had climbed over the previous 5 years, similar to yours. I had the biopsy and had a Gleason score of 7 (3+4). After surgery my uro told me "lucky you didn't do active surveillance ". Do not buy into the saying that PC takes 10 years to kill you... Not Always True. Good Luck Allen

Posts.Title: Starting to get nervous: two pre-surgery questions

Posts.Content: Welcome CinMor, sorry to hear about your husbands condition. Let me share with you a personal experience. When I was diagnosed with PC in 2012 my uncle contacted me to ask if I had decided on treatment. I told him it was going to be robotic surgery and he congratulated me on making a decision. He told me he was diagnosed at 55 and refused treatment, his doctor told him 6-10 years was the best he could hope for. We celebrated his 96th birthday on Dec 26th. Doubtful he had a G 9 but 31 years is a Big Miss in the doctor's guesstimate. Don't give up, stay strong and the future in medicine is an unknown, as Chuck said, new,more effective meds are being brought to market every year Allen

Posts.Title: Results are back. Gleason 9.

Posts.Content: Welcome Rob, I can see why you could be concerned but you are building yourself into a full blown panic. Firstly I doubt you have PC especially since you were 28 when this started. From a distance I would suggest you may just have a prostate infection or another type of urinary infection. And I've never heard "Leg Tingling" being a symptom of PC. Your doctor seems to have sent you for numerous tests, so upon completion did he suggest what the cause could be? Or what the next step would be? Given all the tests you've had, and if you think a clear bone scan will make you feel better, then go for it. But please calm down or you could find your next issue is of the heart type.you didn't say how long the delay was between sex and PSA test, if it was within 48 hours it could cause a slight bump. Obviously you need to pursue this until you feel better, and I wish you good luck. Allen

Posts.Title: How long before I can start working out/bike riding etc.

Posts.Content: After 18 months of 100% continence, I am experience a morning bout of stress leakage. For the past 15 months I have followed the following morning routine: 06:00 I am up and drinking 2-3 cups of coffee. 06:45 I run 10KM I have been doing the same distance in the same time for 15 months, so no change there. My coffee consumption also the same. After about 30 min I feel a small squirt and a couple of occasional ones before reaching home. I have no further leakage during the day or night. The only change I have made is to reduce my kegel exercises from 45 min/day to 12 min/day. I did this after reading several posts about members exercise times and thought I may be doing to much. Has anyone else experienced a return to leakage after a year or so of continence? Allen

Posts.Title: Image Guided Radiation Therapy - week by week

Posts.Content: Bob, I was having my treatments done a year ago today. I had 33 in all. I was in and out in 11-12 minutes. One of the reasons they do a mini cat scan prior to each treatment is so they know your bladder is full and your bowel empty. A full bladder keeps your bowel out of harms way. There is no 2 week honeymoon, I had all 33 done with virtually zero side affects except the last 3 or 4 treatments I experienced light fatigue for 15-30 minutes. It took me 15 min to drive home from hosp. and by the time I arrived I was fine. My Gleason was 3+4 as well and I was 66 YO. Good Luck Allen

It took me 15 min to drive home from hosp. and by the time I arrived I was fine. My Gleason was 3+4 as well and I was 66 YO. Good Luck Allen

Posts.Title: Return of Leakage

Posts.Content: After 18 months of 100% continence, I am experience a morning bout of stress leakage. For the past 15 months I have followed the following morning routine: 06:00 I am up and drinking 2-3 cups of coffee. 06:45 I run 10KM I have been doing the same distance in the same time for 15 months, so no change there. My coffee consumption also the same. After about 30 min I feel a small squirt and a couple of occasional ones before reaching home. I have no further leakage during the day or night. The only change I have made is to reduce my kegel exercises from 45 min/day to 12 min/day. I did this after reading several posts about members exercise times and thought I may be doing to much. Has anyone else experienced a return to leakage after a year or so of continence? Allen
Posts.Title: Return of Leakage

Posts.Title: Concerned Partner

Posts.Content: Congratulations Jefft. I just returned from my oncologist after my 3rd , 6 month PSA test and it remained the same as the previous 3 since my salvage radiation <0.01 I must confess I was really stressed over this one. I spent 10 minutes questioning him about advancements in HT. He said there really hadn't been any Vis a Vis side affects. He said people over weight, smokers, diabetics as well as those on blood thinners and lower back issues have by far the harshest side affects. Anyway I have 6 more months of trying to reduce weight, build muscle mass and party hearty before I go through it all again. Allen
Posts.Title: Thrilled to be in the "Zero Club"!

Posts.Content: Welcome Rob, I can see why you could be concerned but you are building yourself into a full blown panic. Firstly I doubt you have PC especially since you were 28 when this started. From a distance I would suggest you may just have a prostate infection or another type of urinary infection. And I've never heard "Leg Tingling" being a symptom of PC. Your doctor seems to have sent you for numerous tests, so upon completion did he suggest what the cause could be? Or what the next step would be? Given all the tests you've had, and if you think a clear bone scan will make you feel better, then go for it. But please calm down or you could find your next issue is of the heart type.you didn't say how long the delay was between sex and PSA test, if it was within 48 hours it could cause a slight bump. Obviously you need to pursue this until you feel better, and I wish you good luck. Allen
Posts.Title: 29 years old, high PSA

Posts.Content: Robin, There is no finite increase number how big a bump PSA would have after sex, but it wouldn't be 50% based on my experience. Your doctor is the best source to advise you if you're getting close to max on radiation. Doubtful you're in any danger, but I'm not a doctor. Given PC doesn't run in your family why are you obsessed with the search for it versus some common virus? Allen

Posts.Content: This may be unique to me, but just wondering if any members experienced, or continue to experience occasional memory issues after DaVinci? Posts.Content: Hi Ed, my exercise program is as follows. Firstly using ultra sensitive food scale I had to keep track of urine weight at the end of each day: * Three times a day perform kegel exercise as follows: 1) lift floor 25% and hold 5 seconds, lift floor to maximum and hold 10 seconds, lift floor 25% and hold 5 seconds., take a 60 second break and repeat a total of 10 times. Do exercise 3 times day (morning, afternoon,night). * Lift floor to maximum, drop quickly to base 20 times (repeat as above). * once per day walk for 30 minutes while raising bottom floor to 25% and holding for entire walk. The above worked well for me. Good luck Allen

Posts.Content: I just talked to an old friend who lives in a very small town in Canada. He was looking for advice on his extreme rectal pain. His PSA goes between 3.2 and 3.6 and he is 69 years old. He has been experiencing extreme frequency, sore testicles, and rectal pain for 12 weeks. His doctor thinks he has prostatitis plus an enlarged prostate. He was on an antibiotic (tera nor floxacin) for 8 weeks which helped but 2 weeks after he finished script, it returned. He can only stand to drive for 30 minutes before pain forces him to stop. His DR is sending him for a cysto in mid Nov. He of course is worried he has PC. His URO answers questions but unless he knows what to ask no info is forthcoming. Just wondering if anyone had similar symptoms, and could reco questions he should ask his URO. Should he ask for a biopsy? Allen

Posts.Content: Peter you should try Trimix. I wasn't getting firm erections with Cialis or Viagra either. I have had to increase my dosage of Trimix over the past year and will be seeing a urologist specializing in ED, and if necessary he will customize a new Trimix formula for me. The needle (#30) is virtually painless, it takes 5-10 min to take full affect and it will last 15-60 minutes. Your erection will be like it was at 18. Good luck Brave

Posts.Title: Prostate Cancer - Gleason Score of 10

Posts.Content: I had robotic surgery Oct/2012. By Sept 2013 my pas had risen to 0.15. I told my surgeon to book me with an oncologist. I had 33 rounds of radiation. You will need to go for marking (2 tattoos )which is the cancer target. You will need an empty bowel and a full bladder. Your treatments will be 5 days/week until finished. At each treatment you will need empty bowel and full bladder. The total test time will be about 10 minutes, you will lie still on a metal table. There is zero pain I had zero side affects with the exception of a LITTLE fatigue after 25 sessions, the fatigue lasted about 30 minutes They will wait about 90 days after treatments before testing your PSA In my case, my PSA was 0.0 Brave
Posts.Title: Prescribed Radiation Therapy after Surgery

Posts.Content: Mikem, for sure HT will throw you into menopause. Having said that most men get on with it and enjoy life. There will probably be some fatigue and some hot flashes, but they have meds to reduce the hot flashes and you can always take a short afternoon nap to combat fatigue. I assume that radiation is not the 1st choice because the cancer currently is to small to target accurately. The last thing you want is a series of Luke Skywalker laser blasts going into your body on a hit and miss bases. You could always ask your doctor for the pros and cons of both. Brave

Posts.Title: Prostate cancer diagnosed after death

Posts.Content: I just talked to an old friend who lives in a very small town in Canada. He was looking for advice on his extreme rectal pain. His PSA goes between 3.2 and 3.6 and he is 69 years old. He has been experiencing extreme frequency, sore testicles, and rectal pain for 12 weeks. His doctor thinks he has prostatitis plus an enlarged prostate. He was on an antibiotic (tera nor floxacin) for 8 weeks which helped but 2 weeks after he finished script, it returned. He can only stand to drive for 30 minutes before pain forces him to stop. His DR is sending him for a cysto in mid Nov. He of course is worried he has PC. His URO answers questions but unless he knows what to ask no info is forthcoming. Just wondering if anyone had similar symptoms, and could reco questions he should ask his URO. Should he ask for a biopsy? Allen

Posts.Title: having surgery was right for me

Posts.Content: I consume approx. 2200 calories per day. Of that I restrict fat to around 100g, of which 50% comes from olive oil, avocados. I never eat junk food, other than a 6" veggie sandwich from Subway on rare occasions. I eat red meat about twice a month. My meals mostly consist of fish, vegetables, whole grain bread, green tea, fruit and red wine. Other than this PC I am in great health for 67. I also power walk for 8km, 6 days a week weather permitting.
Posts.Title: What type of vitamins to use

Posts.Content: For 30 years before I was diagnosed I drank 3-6 cups of green tea/day, which all the GURUS claimed was the #1 preventative antioxidant to battle prostate cancer. At the end of the day I think if a man has inherited genes that leaves him predisposed to get prostate cancer, then there is a pretty good chance you will get it. Keep in mind that the vitamin business reaps in $Billions annually by convincing people they will prevent something or other. Just live a healthy lifestyle and see what happens. You may want to check your family tree. Allen
Posts.Title: What type of vitamins to use

Posts.Content: I included the olive oil into my total fats, as I stated earlier it along with avocado represents 50% of my daily fats total. I had my annual physical 3 months ago. I am 67 and my cholesterol is 1.1, my BP is 123/74, my heart rate is 67. All in all my diet is serving me well. By the way I do not take any meds with the occasional exception of Ibuprofen after 18 holes of golf B

Posts.Title: Stayed in Zero Club

Posts.Content: Welcome JLynn, you have found a great site for information and support. In addition to the great advice the other members have given, your husband should ask his doctor about taking Viagra or Cialis in advance of treatment. You should also prepare your husband for the incontinence that occurs especially in the days and week(s) following treatment. For me the first week was scary and I was changing pads several times a day, however, as time passes and the effects of doing kegel exercises start working he will see improvement. At the end of 7 weeks I was fully continent . Good luck, your husband will need your support, but in the end it will be ok. Please keep us informed of his progress, and don't hesitate to ask questions. Allen
Posts.Title: 55 yr old husband just diagnosed with PC

Posts.Content: I am in Toronto so on the metric system. I have yet to hear a doctor or scientist say that any of the supplements/foods you eat prevent prostate cancer. For some decades I drank green tea and ate pumpkin seeds, which the hustlers claimed would prevent prostate cancer. Unless I hear it from a medical doctor or legitimate scientist I just take it as background noise from someone hustling their book or promoting products for manufacturers. Even then I'd want to see the sample size the results came from

Posts.Title: What type of vitamins to use

Posts.Content: AZ, re-read my post. One of the people my doctor got advice from was a pharmacist. In fact she is the head of pharmacy at one of the largest cancer hospitals in the country. As I also said, they claim that Trimix that has been frozen won't harm you in any way, it just will not be as affective as the same dosage that has been refrigerated properly but not frozen. If you are getting good results with frozen Trimix, then I suggest you keep on using it.
Posts.Title: Do Not Freeze Trimix

Posts.Content: The last months I needed to use Trimix I did freeze it. I drew the right amount into each syringe from the vial and froze them. It worked just fine. Glad to no longer require that type of help. Allen
Posts.Title: Do Not Freeze Trimix

Posts.Content: I received a call from my surgeon's office this morning telling me to NOT freeze Trimix as it makes it less effective. I had a meeting with him last week and asked the question . He said he hadn't heard anyone doing it before but would ask the ED Guru at the hospital as well as the head of pharmacy. They both said DO NOT freeze the Trimix for the reason above. HE did not say it was dangerous just less effective. FYI B
Posts.Title: Do Not Freeze Trimix

Posts.Content: Bad, I think you have a lot to be thankful for. Your Gleason score is 6 and not 9. I know you see the glass as 1/2 empty but I assure you when the shock passes you will realizes how many men would be happy to trade issues with you. Best of luck as you get on top of your cardiac issue and get on with enjoying your life. Allen

Posts.Title: Need opinions on Da vinci or radical prostatectomy

Posts.Content: Those symptoms could be caused by numerous things from taking a water pill, enlarged prostate, issues with lower back muscles, etc. You don't mention your age which could also be a factor. I would think your first course of action is to discuss it with your GP and they will do a urine analysis, and a DRE, depending on those results they may order a PSA. But at this stage I would put the cancer notion out of your mind. One of my best friends had to urinate a half dozen times on a round of golf. I never felt urgency or frequency, yet I'm the one who ended up with PC... so relax. Allen

Posts.Content: Creek, I was the same, expecting the procedure to be quite uncomfortable. It was no big deal. Posts.Title: Marker placement procedure behind me. ( pun intended )

Posts.Content: He may have had minor side affects, and not at all sure about his sex life. He attend all the family parties and was the life of the party. He had what looked to be about a 38" waist his entire life. He traveled extensively and did numerous sports: curling, golf, swimming, skating. But I guess the therapy affects all men differently. There were times I used to think I should have just gone with the Hormone shots.
Posts.Title: Stopping hormone therapy after PSA undetectable for two years?

Posts.Content: Welcome Kim, you have come to the right place for answers to your pic questions. Good to read you are doing some research that will definitely help. With a PSA that high odds are your husband has cancer and needs to seek medical help quickly from urologist and oncologist who specialize in PC. It is the time for concern but not panic, your husband needs calm support right now. It would help if you could provide more information on his age, family history, PSA progression over the years. We'll be here for you constantly. Allen

Posts.Title: Further action following testing for P.C

Posts.Content: GMan, I am 26 months post op and life does get better, or at least we get used to it. I started with Trimix, then over some months moved to Viagra . However three months ago I got an erection on my own, and it's still the same. So just be patient, you just may get an unexpected surprise. Allen
Posts.Title: Two Years Post Robotic - Life Gets Better

Posts.Content: Dad, No fatigue at all to speak of. I was a bit sleepy twice, they were the treatments #28 and the last one #33. I drove home after the treatments, walked on the treadmill for 15-20 minutes and felt great again. Once the treatments were over I never was bothered by fatigue to this day. I've never had much of a continence issue, last year I started having the occasional stress leak but that was due to my slacking off my original kegel exercises and trying a lighter one. After 2-3 weeks everything returned to normal. Allen

Posts.Title: Radiation log

Posts.Content: Creekrat, I found I had no side affects from radiation (33 rounds). You may experience a very small episode of fatigue after 30 rounds but it will last about 15 minutes and won't keep you from driving or following your normal Schedule. How long do your hot flashes last? The downside to HT is it throws men right into menopause. Now that explains why it isn't womenopause. Good Luck Allen

Posts.Title: What effects will a rattle snake bite have on prostate cancer?

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear that news Dad. In my opinion you should consult an oncologist specializing in prostate cancer. A year after RALPH my PSA began climbing. At 0.17 I met with an oncologist and elected to go with salvage radiation. I had 33 rounds with zero side affects after almost 2 years. My Gleason was 7 (3+4) Good Luck Allen

Posts.Content: Wintertexan, I was fully continent 7 weeks after post op (65). If I feel the risk of a stress leak from sneezing, etc, I brace for it and there is no leakage . I have very minute leakage with ejaculation, I would guesstimate it as 6-10 drops. I could be wrong but I attribute this to the success in surgery plus faithful kegel exercises that I perform 3 times/day (total of 1 hour). I am sure there are many others who achieve zero leakage but I'm not bothered with a few drops. B
Posts.Title: Incontinence while ejaculating.

Posts.Content: If mine lasts 3 1/2 hours my wife will have to invite her GFs for a party. Were you satisfied with the size once you got the injections down pat?
Posts.Title: Penile Injections

Posts.Content: This afternoon is my 1st get together with urologist for my penile injection. I have heard it isn't overly painful, and I fully expect the result will outweigh a little momentary discomfort. I've been told to expect a full erection for 45-90 minutes.That is going to be so G R E A T Would love to hear if anyone had them and got less than a 45 min erection or a disappointing erection. I may be setting my expectations to high but I do hope it is the same size and rigidness as it was before the surgery. B
Posts.Title: Penile Injections

Posts.Content: Why not follow your doctor's advice. I felt capable of playing golf a couple of weeks after surgery but my doctor said 6 weeks so I figured he probably had more experience in this field than me so I waited 6 weeks. Starting early was not putting me in the PGA, but perhaps the hospital. Allen

Posts.Title: Golf?

Posts.Content: Welcome stunt, happy you have decided to switch from lurker to active poster. It is always gratifying to hear someone reading the posts found it helpful in their decision making on how to proceed. Your numbers would indicate this should be a cake walk for you. Good Luck and we look forward to reading posts of your journey. If you have questions during the journey, don't hesitate to ask. Allen
Posts.Title: Surgery Scheduled for January

Posts.Content: Welcome Wilde, my experience with surgery mirrors that of Chuck and jknight. It has been a bit over 2 years and I had no issues out of the ordinary. My incontinence lasted only 7 weeks but returned to a very slight degree 18 months later. I reduced the intensity of my Kegel exercises and quickly returned to fully continent. My ED lasted about 20 months before I could get an erection without Cialis/Viagra. I never had a minute of pain post surgery. Allen

Posts.Title: Advice or comments on my treatment choice

Age.Phrase: <Z> <Z> <Z> I am 66 and just finished my 29th

DoctorRecommended.Sample: However if you go with Robotic Surgery and it doesn't work you can have radiation. I suggest you seek out and meet with a good surgeon, and a good oncologist, and have them go over your records and give you their opinion....Robin, There is no finite increase number how big a bump PSA would have after sex, but it wouldn't be 50% based on my experience. Your doctor is the best source to advise you if you're getting close to max on radiation....Hi Bob, I was advised that the numbers weren't in yet but my DR felt beam radiation could be as effective as surgery when they collected enough data....The urologist had me do another sample that day and it came back the same. He recommended radiation, I said fine and that's where we are at present....In my case once I found out I had the pc the decision was : *Do nothing and probably die in less than 5 years *Treat it with radiation *Treat it with surgery, The urologist recommended surgery I said fine. He recommended robotic and I said fine....Hi Bob, I was advised that the numbers weren't in yet but my DR felt beam radiation could be as effective as surgery when they collected enough data. I elected to go with Robotic surgery and my psa started to reappear after 11 months....Lance,I'm not sure what decisions there are to be made. In my case once I found out I had the pc the decision was : *Do nothing and probably die in less than 5 years *Treat it with radiation *Treat it with surgery, The urologist recommended surgery I said fine....Radiation is over a longer period of time, however you can carry on with your normal daily routine. I suggest you meet with a surgeon and an oncologist who have good track records, and listen to their opinions before you decide....Your doctor is the best source to advise you if you're getting close to max on radiation. Doubtful you're in any danger, but I'm not a doctor....
